title: Does a student loan disbursement count as income in chapter 7 means test? This could make the difference on whether I pass.
question: Please let me know.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy means test,Debt,Nondischargeable debt and student loans,Bankruptcy and debt
answers:
A loan disbursement is not income under any circumstances. A gift is.

[This communication is intended as general information and not specific legal advice, and this communication does not create an attorney-client relationship.]

I can't see how under any circumstances a loan can be considered income. It's definitely not considered so here in the Central District of California. If a loan is income, what is it when it's paid back?

Mark J. Markus, Attorney at Law
http://www.bklaw.com/

This is one of those questions that is interpreted differently in different locations. I would say that a loan is not income here in Las Vegas, but in other areas of the US, the courts have said that it must be included.

I would check with your attorney locally or with the office of the US Trustee in your neighborhood.
